meanings.definition: A person who advocates for the freeing of slaves.
meanings.sent1: The brave emancipationist fought for the rights of enslaved people.
meanings.sent2: The famous speaker was known as an emancipationist for his strong stance against slavery.
meanings.sent3: The young emancipationist accidentally freed the chickens instead of the slaves.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for justice turned her into an emancipationist, breaking the chains of oppression.
meanings.sent5: The town celebrated the local emancipationist who helped many escape bondage.

meanings.definition: Relating to the movement to end slavery.
meanings.sent1: The emancipationist leaders gathered to discuss strategies for abolishing slavery.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts from the emancipationist movement.
meanings.sent3: The colorful banners waved proudly in the emancipationist parade.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a beacon of hope in the dark night of the emancipationist cause.
meanings.sent5: The community came together in an emancipationist spirit to support the freedom of all.
